intro: Diodia pedunculata, commonly known as false wild betony, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its small, tubular flowers are typically purple or blue, arranged in whorls along the stem. Diodia pedunculata is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
